subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any eBay sellers willing to do this?
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1207608054
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

They put links in the adds all the time.  Why should this be any  different?
 
 
 
In a message dated 4/7/2008 5:40:05 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
psfponies@... writes:

 
 
 
Would there be any objections to putting the link to the hack in the  
ebay ad?

Kay

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  Wiliam 
Clarke <reesclarke_reescl> 
wrote:
>
>  www.ufogeek.  
> Where you can get the instructions
>  
> psfponies <psfponies@.ps> wrote:
> opps I  mean:
> 
> Can someone send me the written instructions on how to  hack the 12-
> 469!!
> 
> Kay
> 
> --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
"psfponies" <psfponies@> wrote:
> >
> > I checked to  see what it would cost to sell one of ebay. To list 
> it 
> >  it is $1.00 for $25.00-449.00 plus 8.75% of the initial $25.00 
> >  ($2.19), plus 3.50% of the remaining closing value balance 
($25.01  
> > to $1,000.00)
> > 
> > 
> > I would  be willing to list the one I have plus give the 
> information 
>  > on the free hacking and that fact that you can get one at Radio 
>  > Shack for $24.99 just to shut this guy down. At the most I would 
>  be 
> > out $1.00 to not sell it!!!! Well worth it I'd say.
>  > 
> > Can someone send me the written instructions on how to hack  the 
12-
> > 249.
> > 
> > Kay
> >  
> > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , "LC  
Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Either  that, or anyone willing to make them for $25 + shipping 
> > with  
> > > no profit? You could then list them just like the ones that  
are 
> > > selling...so they pull up identical to the listings  that are 
up 
> > > there. :)
> > > 
> >  > LC
> > > 
> > > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
"itcdeadpeople" 
<ITCdeadpeople@> 
> > >  wrote:
> > > >
> > > > I was thinking if someone  would list a FREE DOWNLOAD of 
> > > instructions for the various  hacks 
> > > > on the Radio Shack units, it could put an end to  the 
business 
> > for 
> > > sellers that are taking  
> > > > advantage of people who are unaware that they could  probably 
> > hack 
> > > the units for 
> >  > > themselves. 
> > > > 
> > > > I have  seen "downloads" of various things listed before. Why 
> > not  
> > > this?
> > > > 
> > > >  Margaret
> > > >
> > >
> >
>  
> 
>
